data.title: Hans Grundig - Schoolboy with a Red Cap [c.1925-28]
data.meta_description:
Hans Grundig (February 19, 1901 - September 11, 1958) was a German painter and graphic artist associated with the New Objectivity movement. He was born in Dresden and, after an apprenticeship as an interior decorator, studied in 1920–1921 at the Dresden School of Arts and Crafts. He then studied at the Dresden Academy from 1922 to 1923.
	
	[Grisebach Auctions, Berlin - Oil on canvas, 100 x 58 cm]
data.text:
Hans Grundig (February 19, 1901 - September 11, 1958) was a German painter and graphic artist associated with the New Objectivity movement. He was born in Dresden and, after an apprenticeship as an interior decorator, studied in 1920–1921 at the Dresden School of Arts and Crafts. He then studied at the Dresden Academy from 1922 to 1923.

[Grisebach Auctions, Berlin - Oil on canvas, 100 x 58 cm]
